新单户住宅的年化销量下降至 676,000 套，比 5 月的 724,000 套低 6.6%，比 2020 年 6 月的 839,000 套低 19.4%。 6 月份新建房屋的中位价仅比 2020 年 6 月上涨 6% 待售新房库存从 5 月份的 5.5 个月供应量跃升至 6 月份的 6.3 个月供应量。去年秋天，它处于仅 3.5 个月的低点。根据美国人口普查局周一公布的数据，6 月份新建房屋的销售量降至 2020 年 4 月冠状病毒大流行初期以来的最低水平。新单户住宅的年化销量下降至 676,000 套，比 5 月的 724,000 套低 6.6%，比 2020 年 6 月的 839,000 套低 19.4%。分析师预计 6 月新屋销售将增长 3.4%。经过一年的疯狂购买和两位数的价格上涨，新建房屋现在无法满足市场上剩余的大部分需求。 6 月份新建房屋的中位价仅比 2020 年 6 月上涨了 6%，虽然从历史上看这是一个很大的涨幅，但与前几个月 15%-20% 的年涨幅相比，这算不了什么。
大多数购房是在高端市场，由于建筑成本飞涨，建筑商无法负担得起负担得起的房屋。尤其是软木木材，在大流行期间飙升了 300% 以上，虽然在上个月大幅回落，但仍比 2019 年的平均水平高出约 75%。其他木材产品仍然要贵得多。 Bleakley 咨询集团首席投资官彼得·布克瓦 (Peter Boockvar) 表示：“我们也知道，存在电器、劳动力和负担得起的地段短缺的问题。” “房屋销售放缓很可能是由于各种延误造成的贴纸冲击和建筑商完成房屋的能力放缓的结合。”待售新房库存从 5 月份的 5.5 个月供应量跃升至 6 月份的 6.3 个月供应量。去年秋天，它处于仅 3.5 个月的低点。 6月份，尚未开工的待售房屋数量创历史新高。 Zillow 经济学家马修·斯皮克曼在一份新闻稿中写道：“未来几个月的年度比较将变得更加困难，因为去年这个时候市场开始飙升并达到大衰退前的高位。” 6 月份的购房者也受到更高的抵押贷款利率的打击，该利率在本月飙升了约四分之一个百分点。虽然这听起来可能并不多，但如果买家已经因房价上涨而感到捉襟见肘，他们就没有足够的财务缓冲来吸收更高的抵押贷款利率。单户住宅的开工量继续增加，尽管速度缓慢且不在市场的最低端。作为未来建设指标的许可证并不像市场需求那样强劲。
虽然毫无疑问，买家的需求仍然强劲，但大部分需求都被负担能力和供应问题所压制。这些迹象在 6 月份清楚地出现在建筑商的住宅网站上，并且是过去两个月削弱住宅建筑商情绪的一个因素。著名建筑商分析师 Ivy Zelman 上个月在一份报告中写道。报告称：“根据我们对显示出降温早期迹象的专有数据的分析，我们正在改变对房地产市场的态度。”
note_en:
Sales of new single family homes fell to an annualized rate of 676,000, 6.6% below May's rate of 724,000 and 19.4% below the June 2020 level of 839,000.
 The median price of a newly built home in June rose just 6% from June 2020
 The inventory of new homes for sale jumped from a 5.5-month supply in May to a 6.3-month supply in June. Last fall, it sat at a low of just 3.5 months.
 Sales of newly built homes dropped in June to the lowest level since the early days of the coronavirus pandemic in April 2020,  according to data released by the U.S. Census Bureau on Monday.
 Sales of new single family homes fell to an annualized rate of 676,000, 6.6% below May's rate of 724,000 and 19.4% below the June 2020 level of 839,000. Analysts were expecting new home sales to increase by 3.4% in June.
  After a year of frenzied buying and price gains in the double digits, newly built homes are now out of reach for much of the demand that remains in the market.
 The median price of a newly built home in June rose just 6% from June 2020, and while that is a large gain historically, it is nothing compared with the 15%-20% annual gains seen in previous months.
 Most of the homebuying is on the higher end of the market, and builders cannot afford to put up affordable homes due to skyrocketing construction costs.
 Softwood lumber, in particular, spiked more than 300% during the pandemic, and while it has fallen back dramatically in the last month, it is still about 75% above its 2019 average. Other lumber products are still significantly more expensive.
 "We also know there are shortages of appliances, labor and affordable lots," noted Peter Boockvar, chief investment officer at the Bleakley Advisory Group. "The moderation in home sales is likely a combination of sticker shock and the slowdown in the ability of builders to finish homes because of a variety of delays."
  The inventory of new homes for sale jumped from a 5.5-month supply in May to a 6.3-month supply in June. Last fall, it sat at a low of just 3.5 months. In June, the number of homes for sale that had not yet been started hit an all-time high.
 "Annual comparisons will get even more difficult in coming months, as it was this time last year that the market began to surge and reach highs not seen since before the Great Recession," wrote Zillow economist Matthew Speakman in a release.
 Buyers in June were also hit with higher mortgage rates, which spiked about a quarter of a percentage point during the month. While that may not sound like a lot, if buyers are already stretched by higher home prices, they have less of a financial cushion to absorb higher mortgage rates.
 Single family housing starts continue to gain, albeit slowly and not on the lowest end of the market. Permits, an indicator of future construction, are not as robust as the market needs.
 While there is unquestionably still strong demand from buyers, much of it is being squelched by affordability and supply issues. Those signs clearly showed up at builder home sites in June and have been a factor in weakening homebuilder sentiment for the past two months. Noted builder analyst Ivy Zelman wrote as much in a note last month.
 "We are shifting our tone on the housing market based on our analysis of proprietary data showing early signs of a cool down," according to the note.
title: 随着新房销售降至大流行低点，住房繁荣结束
title_en: Housing boom is over as new home sales fall to pandemic low

note:
Lordstown Motors 内部的骚乱导致其首席执行官和首席技术官辞职，使该公司面临失败的风险。这项新协议可以通过提供生产其第一辆电动汽车所需的急需资金，使 Lordstown 得以继续发展。如果获得股东批准，对冲基金 YA II PN 将能够购买 3510 万股，约占流通股的 19.9%。首都为近几个月一直在苦苦挣扎的洛兹敦提供了一条生命线。如果股价上涨，这家能够以每股 7.48 美元的价格购买股票的对冲基金也可以从财务上受益。 Lordstown Motors 是前首席执行官史蒂夫·伯恩斯 (Steve Burns) 的另一家公司 Workhorse Group 的一个分支，该公司也是一家公开交易的电池电动运输技术公司。 Workhorse 持有 Lordstown Motors 10% 的股份。这家俄亥俄州汽车制造商成立于 2019 年，并在一年内与特殊目的收购公司 DiamondPeak Holdings Corp. 达成合并，市值为 16 亿美元。该公司计划从 2021 年下半年开始在俄亥俄州洛兹敦的前通用汽车装配厂开始生产 Endurance 皮卡。这些计划动摇了，一系列失误和欺诈指控使公司的问题更加复杂。 2021 年 3 月，卖空公司兴登堡研究公司（Hindenburg Research）表示，它已对洛兹敦汽车公司（Lordstown Motors）持有空头头寸。兴登堡当时表示，其空头头寸是基于一家“没有收入也没有可销售产品的公司，我们认为这在其需求和生产能力方面误导了投资者。”兴登堡否认该公司为其电动皮卡预订了 100,000 辆预购订单，Lordstown Motors 于 1 月份分享了这一数据。卖空者表示，“广泛的研究表明，该公司的订单在很大程度上是虚构的，并被用作筹集资金和授予合法性的道具。”
两个月后，Lordstown 在其第一季度财报中报告称，由于缺乏资金，Endurance 的产量可能会减少一半——从大约 2,200 辆汽车减少到 1,000 辆。在 CEO 和 CTO 辞职的第二天，Lordstown 的高管们试图安抚投资者，让自己陷入一个更深的坑，并声明他们收到了客户的约束性订单，这些订单将为 2022 年 5 月之前的电动皮卡的有限生产提供资金。该公司在天。
note_en:
The tumult within Lordstown Motors, which has resulted in the resignation of its CEO and CTO, has put the company at risk of failing. This new agreement could allow Lordstown to continue by providing the much-needed capital required to produce its first electric vehicle. If approved by shareholders, hedge fund YA II PN will be able to purchase 35.1 million shares, or about 19.9% of outstanding shares.
 The capital provides a lifeline to Lordstown, which has struggled in recent months. The hedge fund, which is able to buy the shares at $7.48 a share, could also benefit financially if the stock price rises.
  Lordstown Motors is an offshoot of former CEO Steve Burns’ other company, Workhorse Group, a battery-electric transportation technology company that is also publicly traded. Workhorse holds a 10% stake in Lordstown Motors.
 The Ohio automaker was founded in 2019, and within a year  reached a deal to merge with special purpose acquisition company DiamondPeak Holdings Corp., with a market value of $1.6 billion. The company had planned to begin production of its Endurance pickup truck starting in the second half of 2021 at the former GM Assembly Plant in Lordstown, Ohio.
 Those plans faltered and a series of missteps and allegations of fraud compounded the company’s problems.
 In March 2021, Hindenburg Research, the short-seller firm whose report on Nikola Motor led to a Securities and Exchange Commission investigation and the resignation of its founder, said it had taken a short position on Lordstown Motors. Hindenburg said at the time that its short position was based on a company that has “no revenue and no sellable product, which we believe has misled investors on both its demand and production capabilities.”
 Hindenburg disputed that the company booked 100,000 pre-orders for its electric pickup truck, a stat shared by Lordstown Motors in January. The short seller said that “extensive research reveals that the company’s orders appear largely fictitious and used as a prop to raise capital and confer legitimacy.”
 Two months later, Lordstown reported in its first-quarter earnings that production volumes of the Endurance would likely be half — from around 2,200 vehicles to just 1,000 — due to a lack of funding.
 Lordstown execs dug themselves into a deeper hole by  attempting to calm investors a day after its CEO and CTO resigned with statements that they had binding orders from customers that would fund limited production of its electric pickup truck through May 2022. The  company retracted those statements within days.
title: 陷入困境的电动汽车公司 Lordstown Motors 在股票销售协议中获得了 4 亿美元的生命线
title_en: Troubled EV company Lordstown Motors gets $400M lifeline in stock-sale agreement

note: 该公司还表示，其旗舰豪华电动轿车 Lucid Air 已获得 11,000 次付费预订。 Lucid 发言人告诉 TechCrunch，扩建部分将用于生产 Project Gravity，这是该汽车制造商即将推出的豪华电动 SUV 的神秘称号。目前对 Gravity 知之甚少，除了它计划于 2023 年上市，并且它将使用与 Air 相同的电池平台。提交给欧盟知识产权局的专利图纸，首先被 Lucid 论坛的一名成员注意到，显示的只是 Lucid 网站上的效果图。发言人补充说，该公司还计划在内部进行更多的零部件生产，包括车身面板冲压件等主要部件。这些零件由外部供应商处理。卡萨格兰德市议会于 3 月批准了扩大近 100 万平方英尺空间的计划。该工厂的第一期工程耗资约 7 亿美元，在破土动工后的 12 个月内创下了历史新高。 Lucid 曾表示，它希望将生产能力从每年约 30,000 辆汽车扩大到 400,000 辆。 Lucid 通往公开市场的道路漫长而曲折。该公司最早于 2018 年首先将目光投向了将电动轿车投入生产，但很快就遇到了资金挑战，将这一时间表推得越来越远。 Lucid 在 2018 年获得了来自沙特阿拉伯主权财富基金的 10 亿美元投资，在 Lucid 与特殊目的收购公司 Churchill Capital IV Corp 的整个合并过程中，Lucid 一直是其最大股东。该合并在上周遇到了一些小问题，当时高管在投资者电话会议上表示，公司未能在一项关键提案上获得足够多的选票——可能是由于散户的兴起和垃圾邮件过滤器的故障。 Lucid 现在将以 Lucid Group 的名义运营，其股票代码为 LCID。
note_en:
The company also said it has 11,000 paid reservations for its flagship luxury electric sedan, the Lucid Air.
 Part of the expansion will be used to accommodate the manufacturing of Project Gravity, the mysterious title given to the automaker’s forthcoming luxury electric SUV, a Lucid spokesman told TechCrunch. Not much is known about Gravity at this point, other than that it’s scheduled to be available from 2023 and that it will use the same battery platform as the Air. Patent drawings submitted to the European Union Intellectual Property Office, first noticed by a member of the  Lucid Forum, reveal little more than the renderings on Lucid’s website.
  The company is also planning on bringing more of the component production in-house, including major pieces such as the body panel stampings, the spokesman added. These parts were being handled by an external supplier.
 The Casa Grande City Council approved the plans to expand the nearly 1 million-square-foot space in March. The first phase of the factory, which cost around $700 million to construct, went up in a record 12 months after breaking ground. Lucid has said that it wants to expand production capacity from around 30,000 vehicles per year to up to 400,000.
 Lucid has had a long, sometimes tenuous road to the public market. The company first set its sights on bringing an electric sedan to production as early as 2018, but it quickly hit funding challenges that pushed this timeline further and further back. Lucid received major funding in 2018 with a $1 billion investment from Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund, which continued to be its largest shareholder throughout Lucid’s  merger with special purpose acquisition company Churchill Capital IV Corp.
 That merger hit  a bit of a hiccup last week when the company failed to garner a sufficient number of votes on a key proposal — likely due to the rise of retail traders and malfunctioning spam filters, executives said in an investor call.
 Lucid, which will now operate under the name Lucid Group, is listed under the ticker symbol LCID.

note:
Beth Esponnette 是 unspun 的联合创始人兼执行主席，这是一家使用机器学习和 3D 编织技术通过人体扫描来制作定制牛仔裤的初创公司。坐在风险合伙人对面，我想知道如果我剪短头发（真的很短），或者留胡子，或者去掉我怀孕的肚子，他们是否会因为我的话而感到更有压力。如果我对我的承诺更加积极，他们会拿出他们的支票簿吗？如果我热情地砸桌子，他们会更有兴趣更好地了解我和我的业务吗？福尔摩斯用一种低得可笑的声音让她的创业公司在一个充满男人的世界里起步。她承诺进行不可能的针刺测试来检测数百种疾病，并收集了亨利·基辛格、乔治·舒尔茨、詹姆斯·马蒂斯和贝齐·德沃斯等有影响力的投资者。她穿着史蒂夫乔布斯的制服——包括三宅一生的高领毛衣——并建立了一支由 800 名才华横溢的人组成的团队。她的谎言是否太过分了？是的。但她不是唯一一个。硅谷和风险投资环境只会加剧她在公司中已有的任何信念以及承诺登月的倾向。上周在一次虚拟听证会上，她推动保护庞大的信息数据库不受政府影响。在此之前，她声称在 2014 年的收入为 1 亿美元，当时实际是 10 万美元。除其他外，这些事情是不可原谅的。但我仍然相信，她认为自己按照硅谷的普遍建议做的事情是正确的：“假装成真。”她曾经借用以前的思想领袖的话说：“这就是当你努力改变事物时会发生的事情，首先他们认为你疯了，然后他们与你战斗，然后突然间你改变了世界。”我想知道她是否只是认为她现在在第二部分。筹集资金创办公司是关于两件事：建立联系和露面。当你是女性时，很难建立联系：“风险投资公司只有大约 12% 的决策者是女性，而且大多数公司仍然没有一个女性合伙人。”即使你有关系，建立关系也可能有点奇怪：我的联合创始人最终与我们的投资者成为短信好友，而我则听到了一些事情的消息。我们在 2019 年达到了 2.8% 的峰值，用于女性领导的初创公司，但在 2020 年，这一比例再次下降至 2.3%，这可能是因为投资者恢复了在不确定时期保持持卡的标准习惯。此外，投资者的预期通常与男性倾向一致。例如，对男性和女性阅读的相同幻灯片和脚本的评价大不相同，绝大多数男性评分更高。福尔摩斯低沉的声音虽然令人反感，但可能使她更有说服力。
不过，要复制福尔摩斯的筹款成功并不容易。如果其他女性试图效仿这一点，她们很可能会受到惩罚：一般来说，积极的男性被认为是积极的，而积极的女性则被视为情绪不稳定。这令人困惑，因为反过来说，如果女性退回到刻板的女性行为，她们就会被视为软弱。希拉里·克林顿 (Hillary Clinton) 在她的总统竞选期间陷入了困境——被批评在刻板的男性特征时表现出咄咄逼人和冷漠，而在表现出刻板的女性特征时被认为是软弱的。更糟糕的是，事实证明，在推销中，女性被问到更多关于潜在损失和风险的预防性问题，而男性被问到更多关于上升和收益的宣传性问题。女性可以通过正面回答任何预防性问题来解决这个问题。福尔摩斯深知这一点，并乐此不疲。这是她获胜的唯一途径。我绝对不是“亲爱的”，但我确实了解她需要角色扮演的第一手资料。我被忽视了；见鬼，我什至被告知要改变我的产品线（胸罩），因为风险投资家不会得到它。他们没有。我屈服了。我不想为她辩护，我也不能。在派对或董事会会议上说她在她的冒险中有多令人讨厌是很容易的，但让我烦恼的是我们特别关注她作为问题，完全绕过了创造她的环境。我记得当我开始我的公司时，我沉浸在 John Carreyrou 诱人的书中想，“哇，我永远不会那样做”。但正如我所看到的压力和偏见，我可以看到系统如何塑造福尔摩斯。为什么我们不能像评判它摧毁的人一样评判我们创造的有偏见的系统？她像拇指一样伸出来，因为，好吧，那里有多少伊丽莎白福尔摩斯？然而，这些问题在系统本身中根深蒂固，正如大卫福斯特华莱士在水上演讲中所暗示的那样，我们看不到它们，我们可能还没有准备好修复它们。下次有人在鸡尾酒会上拿福尔摩斯男中音的声音开玩笑时，请提醒他们，我们给声音低沉的人多付钱是多么愚蠢。前 TechCrunch 首席运营官 Ned Desmond 现在是 SOSV 的高级运营合伙人，该公司投资了 unspun。
note_en:
Beth Esponnette is the co-founder and executive chair of  unspun, a startup that makes custom-fit jeans from a body scan using machine learning and 3D weaving.
  Sitting across from a venture partner, I wonder if they might feel more compelled by my words if I cut my hair short (really short), or grew a beard, or removed my pregnant belly. Would they take out their checkbook if I were more aggressive in what I promised? Would they be more interested in getting to know my business and me better if I passionately slammed the table?
   Holmes  adopted a ridiculously low voice to get her startup off the ground in a world full of men. She promised impossible pinprick tests to detect hundreds of diseases and collected influential investors like Henry Kissinger, George Shultz, James Mattis and Betsy DeVos. She wore a Steve Jobs uniform — including the Issey Miyake turtleneck — and built a  team of 800 brilliant people. Did she go overboard with her lies? Yes. But she’s not the only one. The Silicon Valley and venture landscape only exacerbated whatever beliefs she already had in her company and inclinations to promise the moon.
 Last week at a virtual hearing, she  pushed to keep a huge database of information protected from the government. Before that, she  claimed to have made $100 million in revenue in 2014, when it was really $100,000. These things, among others, are hands-down inexcusable. But I still believe that she thought she was doing the right thing taking the universal advice of Silicon Valley: “Fake it till you make it.”
 She once  said,  borrowing from previous thought leaders: “This is what happens when you work to change things, and first they think you’re crazy, then they fight you and then all of a sudden you change the world.” I wonder if she just thinks she’s now on part two.
 Raising money to start a company is about two things: having connections and making an appearance. Connections are  difficult to make when you’re a woman: “Only about 12% of decision-makers at VC firms are women, and most firms still don’t have a single female partner.”
 And even if you have connections, building relationships can be a bit weird: My cofounders end up being text buddies with our investors, while I hear news of things in passing. We hit a peak of 2.8% of funding going to women-led startups in 2019, but in 2020, that  dropped again to 2.3%, possibly because investors reverted to their standard habits of keeping their cards close during uncertain times. Furthermore, investors generally have expectations that are aligned with male tendencies. For example, identical slides and scripts that are read by men and women are judged very differently, with  men overwhelmingly rated higher. Holmes’ deep voice, although off-putting,  probably made her more convincing.
 It’s not easy to replicate the fundraising success that Holmes had, though. If other women tried to emulate this, they’d likely be penalized: In general, forward men are viewed positively as assertive, while forward women are viewed as  emotionally unstable. This is confusing because, inversely, if women  retreat to stereotypically feminine behaviors, they are viewed as weak. Hillary Clinton got stuck in this during her presidential race — criticized for being aggressive and cold when stereotypically masculine traits and pegged as weak when showing stereotypically feminine traits.
 To make matters worse, it turns out that in pitches, women are  asked more preventative questions about potential loss and risk, while men are asked more promotional questions about upside and gains. Women can  work around this by answering any preventative question in the positive. Holmes knew this deep down and played into it. That was the only way for her to win.
 I am absolutely no  “holmie,” but I do understand firsthand her need to role-play. I’ve been overlooked; hell, I’ve even been told to change my product line (bras) because venture capitalists won’t get it. And they didn’t. I gave in.
 I don’t want to defend her, and I can’t. It’s so easy to drop a line at a party or a board meeting about how obnoxious she was in her venture, but what irks me is that we focus on her specifically as the problem, completely bypassing the environment that created her. I remember soaking up  John Carreyrou’s tantalizing book thinking, “Wow, I’ll never do that,” as I started my company. But as I have seen the pressures and the biases, I can see how the system shaped Holmes.
 Why don’t we judge the biased system we created as much as we judge the person it destroyed? She sticks out like a sore thumb because, well, how many Elizabeth Holmeses are there out there? These problems are so ingrained in the system itself, though, that as  David Foster Wallace alluded to in the water speech, we can’t see them and we probably aren’t ready to repair them.
 The next time someone jokes at a cocktail party about Holmes’ baritone voice, just remind them how dumb is it that we give more money to people with deep voices.
 Former TechCrunch COO  Ned  Desmond is now Senior Operating Partner at SOSV, which has invested in unspun.
title: 我明白了，伊丽莎白福尔摩斯

note: 路透社 7 月 26 日 - 企业软件公司 Medallia Inc (MDLA.N) 周一表示，私募股权公司 Thoma Bravo 将以 64 亿美元现金将公司私有化。 Medallia 股东将获得每股 34 美元的现金，较 6 月 10 日该股票的收盘价溢价近 20%，这是媒体报道这家总部位于旧金山的公司正在考虑进行潜在出售提振股价的最后一个交易日。两年前上市的客户调查软件提供商 Medallia 与 Survey Monkey 和 Qualtrics 等公司展开竞争。 Thoma Bravo 是最大的专注于软件的私募股权公司之一，管理着超过 780 亿美元的资产。其投资组合公司包括信息技术服务提供商 SolarWinds Corp (SWI.N) 和网络安全公司 McAfee Corp (MCFE.O)。 Medallia 与 Thoma Bravo 的交易预计将于今年完成，其中还包括 40 天的“go-shop”期，公司可以在此期间考虑其他交易。 Blackstone Credit 连同 Apollo Capital Management 和 KKR Credit 管理的一些基金将为这笔交易提供债务融资。 Morgan Stanley & Co、BoFA Securities 和 Wells Fargo Securities 担任 Medallia 的财务顾问。
note_en:
July 26 (Reuters) - Enterprise software firm Medallia Inc  (MDLA.N) said on Monday private equity firm Thoma Bravo would take the company private for $6.4 billion in cash.
 Medallia shareholders will receive $34 per share in cash, a premium of nearly 20% to the stock's close on June 10, the last trading day before media reports that the San-Francisco based company was mulling a potential sale boosted the stock price.
 Medallia, the customer survey software provider, that went public over just two years ago, competes with the likes of Survey Monkey and Qualtrics.
 Thoma Bravo is one the largest software-focused private equity firms with more than $78 billion in assets under management. Its portfolio companies include information technology services provider SolarWinds Corp  (SWI.N) and cybersecurity firm McAfee Corp  (MCFE.O).
 Medallia's deal with Thoma Bravo, which is expected to close this year, also includes a 40-day "go-shop" period wherein the company can consider alternative deals.
 Blackstone Credit along with some funds managed by Apollo Capital Management and KKR Credit will provide debt financing for the deal.
 Morgan Stanley & Co, BoFA Securities and Wells Fargo Securities served as the financial advisers to Medallia.
